content:
Excellent! With the exact date, you can now update the **Event Summary** sheet with the correct information.

**Updated Event Summary sheet:**

| Event Name | Date | Location | Number of attendees | Brief notes about the event |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Marketing Conference at Hilton Hotel | 2023-02-10 | Hilton Hotel | [unknown] | Met Rachel from Google, discussed intent-based marketing |

You can also update the **People Met** sheet with the new information.

**Updated People Met sheet:**

| Name | Title/Company | Contact Info | Conversation Notes | Follow-up Action | Follow-up Deadline | Status | Industry/Sector | Event |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Rachel | [unknown] Google | [rachel.google.com](mailto:rachel.google.com) | Discussed intent-based marketing | Send follow-up email | 2023-02-24 | New | Technology > Internet | Marketing Conference at Hilton Hotel |

Now, you have a more complete record of the event and the connection you made with Rachel from Google. You can use this information to follow up with Rachel and explore potential opportunities.

**Tips for following up:**

1. Send a personalized email: Reference your conversation about intent-based marketing and express your interest in continuing the discussion.
2. Keep it concise: Keep your follow-up email brief and to the point, focusing on the next steps or potential collaboration.
3. Show value: Highlight your expertise or resources that might be relevant to Rachel's work at Google.
4. Be respectful: Respect Rachel's time and priorities, and don't push for a meeting or call if she's not interested.

By following up with Rachel and other connections, you can nurture your network and potentially uncover new opportunities.
